Articles.Content: So, as you may know, DayZ developers love KSP to death. Recently, the very (very very) early alpha came out. I'm wondering who else has got it, and if you haven't why? I don't blame you for not wanting the buggiest game on Earth, but I wanted to own it very early on.
Ive already got for Arma, no reason to buy a standalone

So, as you may know, DayZ developers love KSP to death

I can see it now...

"DayZ: Munar Zombie DLC"

The more I think of it, the less it seems terrible...

DayZ? That's still a thing?

I'm afraid so.

If they had a single player version of it I would try it.

I just don't see the point of playing a zombie survival game and getting heat shot 20 times by other players.

You might as well just play a regular MMO shooter.

I bought it last night. I would hardly call it a "standalone" (other than the fact that you dont need to buy arma3) it still just feels like Dayzmod2.

For a zombie survival game there arent many zombies

I dont play Arma Day-Z because i use a mac, if the could make it for the Mac i would.

And now dont say that mac's cant handle it, because ARMA 2 can.

If they had a single player version of it I would try it.

I just don't see the point of playing a zombie survival game and getting heat shot 20 times by other players.

You might as well just play a regular MMO shooter.

The difference between Day Z and an MMO shooter is the people, you forge alliances, build HQs, skirmish with other groups, much, MUCH more depth, however it does take a while to get into. I'd not assume that's an issue for a KSP player, however.

I saw it on the Devil Dog Gamers channel. It looks promising as far as DayZ goes. I really like what seems to be the addition of a lot of building interiors. I love buildings you can enter. Of course, my problem with DayZ is still people like DDG. Don't get me wrong, I love the videos, but the reason I stopped playing DayZ was that I was tired of the zombies being a sidenote in a zombie survival game. The focus of the game was either killing other players, or avoiding being killed by other players, and until I am convinced the standalone has fixed that problem, I'm not interested.

Of course if I had a group of local friends who all played the game then it would be fantastic for me. But I don't, and so I'm really not.
